title: Birth rate in Italy 2018 , by region
summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in the y axis.
The maximum Birth rate per thousand inhabitants 9.0 is found at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and the minimum is found at Sardinia where Month is 5.7.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants of Month Sardinia is 1.58% smaller than the maximum value at Trentino-South Tyrol.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Birth rate per thousand inhabitants for 20 number of Months.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in the y axis.
The maximum Birth rate per thousand inhabitants 9.0 is found at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and the minimum is found at Sardinia where Month is 5.7.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants of Month Sardinia is 1.58% smaller than the maximum value at Trentino-South Tyrol.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in the y axis.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is appeared to be the highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.
Second maximum Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is found at Month Campania.
The difference of Birth rate per thousand inhabitants between the highest and lowest Month is 3.3.
Month Trentino-South Tyrol is higher than any other Months with value 9.0, followed by Campania, and Sicily. Down to Month Sardinia with the lowest value 5.7.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants has decreased over the past 20 Months.
Month Lazio, Apulia, Aosta Valley, and Veneto have the same Birth rate per thousand inhabitants.
The Month Sardinia tends to be 1.28 percent lower than average.
